title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Talks between Russia and Ukraine on a potential cease-fire ended with no deal as Moscow intensified its assault, killing at least 10 civilians in a shelling attack on residential neighborhoods in the eastern city of Kharkiv and pursuing efforts to seize the capital, Kyiv.

The U.S. and EU blocked Russia's central bank from using its emergency reserves to protect the economy from the Western pressure campaign, a salvo the bank's governor said risked triggering a financial crisis.

---

Iranian and U.S. officials are entering a crucial week of talks to restore the 2015 nuclear deal, with significant differences remaining on several key issues.

---

A case over federal authority to limit greenhouse-gas emissions drew out sharply different principles during arguments at the Supreme Court.

---

Climate experts called an assessment of the impacts of climate change the direst ever offered by the IPCC, a panel of scientists convened by the U.N.

---

The Taliban said Afghans will no longer be allowed to leave the country without a good reason, and women will be barred from traveling without a chaperone, rejecting a key U.S. demand.

---

The FDA approved a new customized, cell-based treatment for blood cancer from J&J that is the first such therapy in the U.S. to be developed initially in China.
